item.title: By: arthur
item.dc:creator: arthur
item.description:
Actually... I meant "plane" not "pleine"-- "plane" is the verb in "Ã‡a Plane Pour Moi," while "pleine" is an adjective. "Pleine" can be translated as "full" but can also mean "pregnant" if referring to livestock.
Okay, I'm done being a pedant. Carry on with your great blog!
item.content:encoded:
Actually…
I meant “plane” not “pleine”– “plane” is the verb in “Ã‡a Plane Pour Moi,” while “pleine” is an adjective. “Pleine” can be translated as “full” but can also mean “pregnant” if referring to livestock.

Okay, I’m done being a pedant. Carry on with your great blog!
